Christina Bardwell Smith, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Winthrop Hiram Smith Jr. of Greenwich, Conn., was married yesterday to Robert Joseph DiSabato Jr., the son of Mr. and Mrs. DiSabato of Westwood, Mass. The Rev. Michael Moynihan performed the ceremony at St. Michael the Archangel Roman Catholic Church in Greenwich.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Amherst College, where they met.

Mrs. DiSabato, 23, teaches the second grade at the Pear Tree Point School in Darien, Conn. Her father is an executive vice president of Merrill Lynch & Company in New York and the chairman of Merrill Lynch International. Her parents also own the Pitcher Inn in Warren, Vt. The bride's paternal grandfather, the late Winthrop H. Smith, was the first chairman of Merrill, Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Beane, as the brokerage house was then known.

Mr. DiSabato, also 23, is an associate financial consultant working in the Fairfield, Conn., office of Merrill Lynch. His mother, Joan DiSabato, is a teacher at the Norwood Cooperative Nursery School in Norwood, Mass. His father is the vice president of Inland Underwriters Insurance Agency in Boston.
